lines.text: La-la-la-la-la-la.
La-la-la-la-la-la.
You see.
It's easy.
Look at me, I'm dancing.
I fall in love too easily, I fall in love too fast.
[last lines]

[singing]
Anchors Aweigh, my boys, Anchors Aweigh.

[singing]
Farewell to college joys, we sail at break of day.

[singing]
Through our last night on shore, drink to the foam. / Until we meet once more, here's wishing you a happy voyage home. / Anchors Aweigh.
What makes the sunset? What makes the moon rise? Is it my love for you?
She begged me, true?
True, true!
She pleaded.
Got down on her bended knees.
Lola, baby... Forgotten you? Aw, honey, with the picture of you I've got in my mind, why even across the phone I can see every...
From the heart of a lonely poet, came a song for the girl he adored. 'Tho she tried very hard not to show it, she was terribly, terribly bored.
[at Donald's school]

[to Joe]
Tell us how you got your medal.
Alright, I'll tell you how I got my medal. Now close your eyes... and try to think of the most beautiful place you've ever with greenest grass and the singingest birds and the shiningest sun.
[Cut to Donald's thoughts]
Can you see it?
Yeah!
Good! Now imagine me walking along, happy as a lark. Can you see me?
Yeah!

Good! Of course, back then in the navy we wore white suits with blue stripes and little white hat with a little red ball on top. Oh, I was so happy I ran and leaped and played, just for the fun of it! My, it felt good! Oh, it was such a wonderful, wonderful day! When all of a sudden I stepped into a big hole and fell, right to the bottom of it! I seemed to be in a long tunnel. 'Way ahead I could see light, so I started towards. At the end I found myself in a strange land! It looked... well, it looked just like page out of story books. And everything was hushed and still, like your room at night after you've gone to sleep.
You saved my life, so you owe me something.
Oh, it was I who saved your life, so now I owe *you* something! Hey look, have you gone crazy?
Look, I didn't ask you to save my life, but you did. So now I feel you are responsible for me.
Well I don't!
Well, what's the good of having a life saved when you can't have any fun with it?

[sings]
Jealousy, you constantly torture me / I sometimes wonder that this spell I'm under / Can only be a melody for I know no one but me has won your heart.

[sings]
What a dish, what a dream, what a dame! And she lives alone.
[first lines]
On behalf of your commanding officer I'm sure I can tell Mr. Jose Iturbi that the officers and crew of ship are grateful to him for coming here, to lead our naval bands in this ceremony.
Along with every other civilian, it is I who am grateful to you, and to all the men in the United States navy.

[singing]
And so comparing you with all of these things is all that I can do / Because they add up to the charm of you.
